title: The Question Keeper

dialogue.speaker: Archivist
dialogue.text: *surrounded by journals* I've been collecting the questions asked here for five years. Look—thousands of them, and not one needs an answer.

dialogue.speaker: Visitor
dialogue.text: *browsing pages* 'Why do I exist?' 'What is love?' 'Who asks the asker?' These are the same questions I have!

dialogue.speaker: Archivist
dialogue.text: *gentle smile* That's the beauty—every question is both utterly unique and completely universal. Your 'why' is yours alone, yet it joins the eternal 'why' we all share.

dialogue.speaker: Maya
dialogue.text: *entering with new journal* Another month of questions to add. This one's my favorite: 'If I stop asking, do I cease to exist?'

dialogue.speaker: Visitor
dialogue.text: *suddenly tearful* All these questions... it's like reading my own soul written by thousands of hands.

dialogue.speaker: Child's Voice
dialogue.text: *from outside* My question for today: Why do questions feel more true than answers?

dialogue.speaker: Archivist
dialogue.text: *writing it down* And into the archive it goes—another thread in the tapestry of our shared wondering.

scene_context: In the archives of the Questions Quarter, an archivist maintains a growing collection of questions, revealing how individual uncertainty connects us all in shared mystery.
visual_elements: Room filled with journals, questions floating like butterflies, pages that seem to breathe with inquiry
